job_tasks.phrase: Building modern web apps using top-notch libraries and tools.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly describes the core activity of developing software applications, which falls under traditional software engineering tasks.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhancing cloud-native backends using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.
job_tasks.justification: This describes the development and integration of backend services, specifically mentioning cloud technologies, which is a key aspect of modern software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
job_tasks.justification: Code review is a standard software engineering practice aimed at maintaining code quality and ensuring it meets defined standards and requirements.

job_tasks.phrase: Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.
job_tasks.justification: While framed as something the candidate will NOT be doing, it describes a type of software maintenance task that is part of the broader software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase, also framed negatively, refers to operational aspects of software maintenance and infrastructure management, which are related to software engineering practices.

soft_skills.phrase: Reviewing code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
soft_skills.justification: Code review inherently involves collaboration and communication to ensure shared understanding and adherence to standards.

soft_skills.phrase: Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
soft_skills.justification: This phrase, framed negatively, highlights the importance of efficient communication and collaboration, implying a preference for roles that avoid unproductive meetings.

soft_skills.phrase: Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 180-min Technical Decision-Making.
soft_skills.justification: The emphasis on specific, timed technical challenges and decision-making points to a need for strong problem-solving skills and a pragmatic approach to evaluating candidates.
This question encourages candidates to take initiative and demonstrate their capabilities, suggesting a role that values ownership and proactive contribution.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on traditional software engineering tasks such as building web applications, enhancing cloud-native backends, and code reviews. There is no mention of AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, or any specific AI/ML technologies. The mention of 'AI-Augmented' in the title appears to be a descriptor of the company or its tools rather than the core responsibilities of the role itself, which are purely software engineering focused.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the tasks involved, which are all within the domain of traditional software engineering. There is no ambiguity regarding AI/ML responsibilities, leading to a high confidence in the assigned profile.
